body:
You haven't shown any bug here.  We use the issue tracker only for bugs; we prefer that people ask questions as described at https://golang.org/wiki/Questions .  Thanks.

You have some misunderstanding about types, methods, and interfaces, but I'm not sure precisely what it is.  `BarInterface` is satisfied by any type that implements the method `Bar() string`.  The type `*Foo` implements that interface.  The function `foo` in your example returns a value of type `*Foo`.  That type implements the interface, so all is well.  I'm not sure why you think it wouldn't be.
